author: npandrei
body:
## Steps to reproduce

```
- Install PowerShell 7.1.1 on macOs Catalina 10.15.7
- Install PowerShell 7.1.1 on Windows 10 20H2
- Enable OpenSSH on Windows 10 from features. Also tried with latest beta version (v8.1.0.0p1-Beta), same result
- Connect using ssh from macOS to Windows 10, using the Terminal 2.10
```

## Expected behavior

```
Be able to use arrow keys (navigate through history, edit current command, use test editors etc)
```

## Actual behavior

```
Arrows are not working
```

## Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```
macOS

PSVersion                      7.1.1
PSEdition                      Core
```

## Other scenarios that work

1) Connecting from macOS to Ubuntu Server 20.04.2 with PowerShell 7.1.1 on both behaves as expected. 

```

----                           -----

SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

2) SSH from macOS Terminal with /bin/zsh as shell to Windows 10 20H2 behaves as expected. So the problem is when I use on macOS pwsh as shell and SSH from it.

3) SSH from Windows Terminal to another Windows 10 20H2 behaves as expected. 

Same version of PowerShell and PSReadLine on all machines.

comments.author: jborean93
comments.body: When you say you are connecting through ssh are you using `ssh username@host` or are you using `Enter-PSSession`?

comments.body:
> When you say you are connecting through ssh are you using `ssh username@host` or are you using `Enter-PSSession`?

comments.author: jborean93
comments.body: Thanks, the only thing I would think to check is if `PSReadline` is active `Get-Module PSReadLine`. I'm not sure what else it could be apart from ssh issues on the server side. Sorry I couldn't be any further help.
